TopicTitle: Platform Enigma- an off topic chat thread.

Articles.Content: Good to know it wasn't anything more serious.
Wow, we have almost reached 200 pages! Just 2 more to go!
Don't scare us like that, your'e a combat medic, there was good reason to believe it was some nation-threatening event.
*ragebot's eyes are displaying this...I think you'll need to restart his brain*
I shall kill you all!
can't see the image...

Don't scare us like that, your'e a combat medic, there was good reason to believe it was some nation-threatening event.

I'm not a medic. Not for another 7-8 months. And even then I won't be deployed for like, 2 years.

I shall kill you all!

*tsar bomba*

It's the only way to be sure.

I'm not a medic. Not for another 7-8 months. And even then I won't be deployed for like, 2 years.

Still... (ihate10chars)

can't see the image...

It's a cat, in a vase. A guy puts his hand near it, it goes in. he takes it away, the cat pops out like a gopher. this happens twice the the gif loops.

*ragebot, still believing himself to be a kitten, attempt to groom himself...and promptly accidentally cuts his tongue off on one of the sharper bits of metal.*
Awww, poor kitty! *Welds up tongue*

Still... (ihate10chars)

It's complicated.

Basically, I sign up as a non-combat medic, and spend 2 years in training for that role. After that, I need to be deployed for about a month on the frontlines on non-combat duties, like working at the FOB, then I can apply to be a combat medic directly attached to a squad at all times.

Edited June 3, 2013 by Mercy
Said unit instead of squad. I'm always in a unit!

It's a cat, in a vase. A guy puts his hand near it, it goes in. he takes it away, the cat pops out like a gopher. this happens twice the the gif loops.

*ragebot, still believing himself to be a kitten, attempt to groom himself...and promptly accidentally cuts his tongue off on one of the sharper bits of metal.*

Oooh, the kitty in the Pringles tube one!

Silly kitty, don't hurt yourself...

Awww, poor kitty! *Welds up tongue*

note: ragebot has a human face, and thus a human tongue. remember he looks for the most part like this:

Oh my god you guys have posted way too much today.

Like, the past 16 hours have resulted in more than 20 pages worth of posts to sort.

note: ragebot has a human face, and thus a human tongue. remember he looks for the most part like this:

[snip]

Well I was turned into a cat. So you're the lucky one. I think.

We've been well behaved, though Odin! And it'll make for interesting read, if nothing else

Woohoo, 200th page!

Oh my god you guys have posted way too much today.

Like, the past 16 hours have resulted in more than 20 pages worth of posts to sort.

I had a feeling he'd speak up at some point...

I had a feeling he'd speak up at some point...

*batts at Jedimaster's face.*
Pardon me if I'm being stupid here, but wouldn't it be preferable to be a non-combat medic?

*batts at Jedimaster's face.*

Bad kitten! come back and cuddle! xD

Pardon me if I'm being stupid here, but wouldn't it be preferable to be a non-combat medic?

I suppose, safety wise, yes.

However, non-combat medics are not with a squad. We would just co-ordinate the Medivac and try and help them at the FOB. If I'm a combat medic, I can help a soldier as soon as he's shot. More chance of him surviving.

Bad kitten! come back and cuddle! xD

*reattaches jaw* Thanks. Why do you keep helping me even though I'm a SW fan?

Bad kitten! come back and cuddle! xD

*does so and makes a very distorted mew via whatever vocal speakers he has join' on*

*reattaches jaw* Thanks. Why do you keep helping me even though I'm a SW fan?

Sci-fi nerds gotta sstick together, regardless of franchise.

Also, given that JJ Abrams is directing the new Star Wars movie, and he's said in the past that all his movies take place in the same continuity, Star Trek and Star Wars will become related.
